metadata.title: CVE-2021-2154 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: DML). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.33 and prior.Easily exploitable vulnerability allows high privileged attacker withnetwork access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server.Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized abilityto cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQLServer. CVSS 3.1 Base Score 4.9 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-2154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.34-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mariadb-10.1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
